content.description: Start low at the bottom of a thin left leaning crack. Follow the crack up and top out approximately 1130 oclock relative to the start.
content.location: At the rightmost of the boulder, at a thin left leaning crack.

content.description: Start low at the slanting thin crack on the right side of the boulder. Work your way up the crack and then on a couple crimps to the left (may be wet) and finish around 11 o'clock relative to the start, above the middle of the left leaning crack.
content.location: Rightmost of the boulder, at a chalked hold low at the bottom of a thin crack.

content.description: Start matched on the same big chalked undercling as for L'Orion. Instead of traversing right through thin holds toward the start of Omicron Crack, make a big move up and right to the finger crack. From there, top out up Omicron as normal to the left of the little tree (upper thin crack is off)
content.protection: Landing is great, just a pad or two

content.description: Start low at the bottom of a thin left leaning crack. Follow the crack and then left to good crimps (left most crimp can be wet), topping out at the end of the crack, left of the small tree. The main crack is on, but the smaller horizontal and edge above is off.
content.location: At a thin crack on the right side of the boulder.

content.description: Start with hands matched on the big chalked undercling. Work your way right on thin holds to Omicron Crack and up. Upper thin crack is off.
Start by the obvious undercling, move left and top out via the left arete.
content.location: Leftmost problem on history of flight

content.description: Fun boulder with a variety of problems V0-V5, about 10-15' high with good landings. Easily identified by the distinctive left leaning thin crack beginning at the lower right corner.
